app.service.cepik_service module

class app.service.cepik_service.CepikSevice(driver: WebDriver, car_details: CarDetails, url: str = 'https://historiapojazdu.gov.pl/strona-glowna/')[source]

Bases: object

Class representing a Cepik service for retrieving car reports.

Args:

driver (selenium.webdriver.Chrome): Selenium Chrome driver. car_details (CarDetails): Car details including registration number, VIN, and first registration date. vehicle_information (List[VehicleHistoryInformation], optional): List of information to retrieve from the car report. Defaults to [VehicleHistoryInformation.MOT_STATUS, Vehicle

*HistoryInformation.INSURANCE_STATUS].

url (str, optional): URL of the Cepik service website. Defaults to “https://historiapojazdu.gov.pl/strona-glowna/”.

car_details: CarDetails
driver: WebDriver
get_car_report() → dict[VehicleHistoryInformation, str][source]

Method: get_car_report

This method retrieves a report for a car based on the car details and vehicle information provided.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the car report information.

url: str = 'https://historiapojazdu.gov.pl/strona-glowna/'
vehicle_information = [VehicleHistoryInformation.MOT_STATUS, VehicleHistoryInformation.INSURANCE_STATUS]

app.service.drivers module

class app.service.drivers.ChromeDriver(chrome_options: Options)[source]

Bases: object

The ChromeDriver class is used to create a Chrome instance with specified Chrome options.

Parameters:

  • chrome_options (Options) – The options to configure the Chrome instance.

  • driver_base (WebDriver) – The base WebDriver class to use. Default is Chrome.

chrome_options: Options
create() → WebDriver[source]

Create a Chrome instance with the specified Chrome options.

Returns:

A Chrome instance created with the specified Chrome options.

driver_base

alias of WebDriver

class app.service.drivers.ChromeDriverLinux(chrome_options: Options, service: Service)[source]

Bases: ChromeDriver

ChromeDriverLinux class

The ChromeDriverLinux class is a subclass of ChromeDriver that is specialized for Linux operating systems. It takes an instance of the Service class as a parameter * in its constructor.

Make sure you have the necessary dependencies and setup to use the ChromeDriver on Linux before using this class.

Methods

create() → WebDriver[source]

Creates a Chrome driver with the specified options and service.

Returns:

The created Chrome driver.

service: Service

app.service.models module

class app.service.models.CarDetails(registration: str, vin: str, first_registration_date: str)[source]

Bases: object

The CarDetails class represents the details of a car.

Attributes:

registration (str): The registration number of the car. vin (str): The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) of the car. first_registration_date (str): The date of the car’s first registration.

app.service.options_builder module

class app.service.options_builder.ChromeOptionsBuilder(options=<class 'selenium.webdriver.chrome.options.Options'>)[source]

Bases: object

A builder class for configuring ChromeOptions.

Args:

options (Options, optional): The base options. Defaults to Options().

Returns:

ChromeOptionsBuilder: An instance of ChromeOptionsBuilder.

Methods:

no_sandbox: Adds the ‘–no-sandbox’ argument to the options. no_screen: Adds the ‘–headless’ argument to the options. no_dev_shared_memory: Adds the ‘–disable-dev-shm-usage’ argument to the options. build: Returns the built ChromeOptions.

Example:
options = ChromeOptionsBuilder()

.no_sandbox() .no_screen() .no_dev_shared_memory() .build()

build() → Options[source]

Build the options and return them.

Returns:

The built options.

no_dev_shared_memory() → Self[source]

Disable dev-shm-usage option.

Returns:

Self instance.

no_sandbox() → Self[source]

Apply the ‘–no-sandbox’ option to the current instance of the WebDriver.

Returns:

The current instance of the WebDriver with the ‘–no-sandbox’ option applied.

no_screen() → Self[source]

Set the headless option to True, indicating that the browser should run without a visible screen.

Returns:

self - The current object instance.

app.service.page_utils module

class app.service.page_utils.VehicleHistoryInformation(value, names=None, *, module=None, qualname=None, type=None, start=1, boundary=None)[source]

Bases: Enum

Enum class to represent vehicle history information.

Possible values: - MOT_STATUS: Represents the MOT status information, its value is css selector used to obtain mot information. - INSURANCE_STATUS: Represents the insurance status information, its value is css selector used to obtain mot information.

INSURANCE_STATUS = '.oc .strong'
MOT_STATUS = '.tech .strong'
app.service.page_utils.map_report_result(result: dict[VehicleHistoryInformation, str]) → dict[VehicleHistoryInformation][source]

Maps the result dictionary containing VehicleHistoryInformation as keys and corresponding str values to a new dictionary with mapped keys based on the input values.

Parameters:

result – The input dictionary containing VehicleHistoryInformation as keys and str as values.

Returns:

A new dictionary with mapped keys based on the input values.
